alert.note: Alert for Haywood (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 26 at 4:29PM EDT until May 26 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Haywood County in western North Carolina... * Until 800 PM EDT. * At 429 PM EDT, At 420 PM EDT, Emergency management reported rapidly rising stream levels and minor flooding along the West Fork Pigeon River after about 2 to 3 inches of basin average rainfall has fallen. Expect continued rising of streams and river levels this this evening as rounds of heavy rainfall will return to the area. Developing out of bank conditions are likely, especially above Lake Logan. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Black Balsam Area, Graveyard Fields, B.R. Parkway-Black Balsam To Mount Pisgah, B.R. Parkway-Balsam Gap To Black Balsam Area, Sunburst and Cruso. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
